name: lascaux-cave-paintings
description: Prehistoric humans painted elaborate animal scenes in caves in modern-day France.

name: first-writing
description: Sumerians developed cuneiform, one of the earliest known writing systems.

name: pyramids-giza
description: The largest Egyptian pyramid was built as a tomb for Pharaoh Khufu.

name: code-hammurabi
description: The Babylonian king established one of the oldest written legal codes.

name: first-olympics
description: Ancient Greeks held the first recorded Olympic Games at Olympia.

name: homer-iliad
description: The Greek poet composed the epic tale of the Trojan War.

name: buddha-enlightenment
description: Siddhartha Gautama achieved enlightenment, founding Buddhism.

name: confucius-teachings
description: The Chinese philosopher began spreading his influential ethical teachings.

name: parthenon-completed
description: Athens finished constructing the iconic temple to the goddess Athena.

name: socrates-death
description: The Athenian philosopher was executed by drinking hemlock.

name: library-alexandria
description: The ancient world's greatest library was established in Egypt.

name: dead-sea-scrolls-written
description: Jewish scribes created ancient religious manuscripts found near the Dead Sea.

name: jesus-crucifixion
description: Jesus of Nazareth was crucified in Jerusalem, founding Christianity.

name: colosseum-completed
description: Rome finished building its massive amphitheater for gladiatorial games.

name: christianity-legalized
description: Emperor Constantine issued the Edict of Milan, ending Christian persecution.

name: bible-latin-vulgate
description: Saint Jerome completed his Latin translation of the Bible.

name: muhammad-revelation
description: The Prophet Muhammad received the first verses of the Quran, founding Islam.

name: book-of-kells
description: Irish monks created an illuminated manuscript of the four Gospels.

name: tale-of-genji
description: Murasaki Shikibu wrote what is often called the world's first novel.

name: notre-dame-construction
description: Work began on the iconic Gothic cathedral in Paris.

name: oxford-founded
description: The oldest English-speaking university began formal instruction.

name: marco-polo-china
description: The Venetian explorer arrived at the court of Kublai Khan.

name: divine-comedy
description: Dante Alighieri completed his epic poem exploring the afterlife.

name: printing-press
description: Johannes Gutenberg invented movable type printing in Europe.

name: sistine-chapel-ceiling
description: Michelangelo finished painting his masterpiece on the chapel ceiling.

name: protestant-reformation
description: Martin Luther posted his 95 Theses, challenging Catholic Church practices.

name: shakespeare-hamlet
description: William Shakespeare completed his famous tragedy about the Danish prince.

name: king-james-bible
description: The influential English translation of the Bible was completed.

name: taj-mahal-completed
description: The Mughal emperor finished building the famous mausoleum for his wife.

name: paradise-lost
description: John Milton published his epic poem about the fall of man.

name: newton-principia
description: Isaac Newton published his laws of motion and universal gravitation.

name: bach-well-tempered
description: Johann Sebastian Bach finished his influential collection of keyboard music.

name: encyclopedia-published
description: Diderot and d'Alembert began publishing their Enlightenment encyclopedia.

name: wealth-of-nations
description: Adam Smith published his foundational work on modern economics.

name: mozart-don-giovanni
description: Mozart's opera about the legendary seducer premiered in Prague.

name: beethoven-ninth
description: Beethoven premiered his final symphony, including the Ode to Joy.

name: first-photograph
description: Joseph Nicéphore Niépce captured the world's first permanent photograph.

name: slavery-abolished-uk
description: Britain passed the Slavery Abolition Act, freeing slaves in most colonies.

name: communist-manifesto
description: Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels published their influential political pamphlet.

name: origin-of-species
description: Charles Darwin published his theory of evolution by natural selection.

name: slavery-abolished-us
description: The 13th Amendment ended slavery throughout the United States.

name: first-impressionist-exhibition
description: Monet, Renoir, and others held their first independent art exhibition in Paris.

name: phonograph-invented
description: Thomas Edison invented a device to record and play back sound.

name: first-motion-picture
description: The Lumière brothers held the first public film screening in Paris.

name: first-modern-olympics
description: Athens hosted the revival of the ancient Olympic Games.

name: freud-interpretation-dreams
description: Sigmund Freud published his groundbreaking work on psychoanalysis.

name: first-powered-flight
description: The Wright brothers achieved the first powered airplane flight.

name: picasso-demoiselles
description: Picasso completed his revolutionary proto-Cubist painting.

name: titanic-sinks
description: The unsinkable ocean liner struck an iceberg and sank on its maiden voyage.

name: women-suffrage-uk
description: British women over 30 gained the right to vote for the first time.

name: women-suffrage-us
description: The 19th Amendment granted American women the right to vote.

name: jazz-age-begins
description: Jazz music exploded in popularity, defining the Roaring Twenties.

name: first-talking-film
description: The Jazz Singer became the first feature-length film with synchronized dialogue.

name: penicillin-discovered
description: Alexander Fleming discovered the first antibiotic, revolutionizing medicine.

name: first-television-broadcast
description: The BBC began the world's first regular high-definition television service.

name: wizard-of-oz
description: The classic Technicolor musical fantasy premiered in Hollywood.

name: citizen-kane
description: Orson Welles directed what many consider the greatest film ever made.

name: un-human-rights
description: The United Nations adopted a landmark document on human rights.

name: nineteen-eighty-four
description: George Orwell published his dystopian novel about totalitarian surveillance.

name: dna-structure
description: Watson and Crick discovered the double helix structure of DNA.

name: polio-vaccine
description: Jonas Salk's vaccine was declared safe and effective against polio.

name: disneyland-opens
description: Walt Disney opened his first theme park in Anaheim, California.

name: elvis-ed-sullivan
description: Elvis Presley's television appearance launched rock and roll into the mainstream.

name: birth-control-pill
description: The FDA approved the first oral contraceptive pill for women.

name: beatles-ed-sullivan
description: The Beatles' American TV debut launched the British Invasion.

name: civil-rights-act
description: Landmark US legislation outlawed discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

name: woodstock
description: Nearly half a million people gathered for the iconic music festival.

name: moon-landing
description: Neil Armstrong became the first human to walk on the Moon.

name: stonewall-riots
description: LGBTQ patrons resisted a police raid, sparking the gay rights movement.

name: first-email
description: Ray Tomlinson sent the first network email using the @ symbol.

name: star-wars-release
description: George Lucas's space opera became a cultural phenomenon.

name: first-test-tube-baby
description: Louise Brown became the first baby conceived through IVF.

name: walkman-released
description: Sony introduced the portable cassette player that changed how people listened to music.

name: mtv-launches
description: The first 24-hour music television channel began broadcasting.

name: aids-identified
description: Scientists first recognized and named the AIDS epidemic.

name: michael-jackson-thriller
description: Michael Jackson released the best-selling album of all time.

name: live-aid
description: A dual-venue rock concert raised millions for Ethiopian famine relief.

name: chernobyl-disaster
description: The world's worst nuclear accident occurred at a Soviet power plant.

name: world-wide-web
description: Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web at CERN.

name: hubble-launched
description: NASA launched the space telescope that revolutionized astronomy.

name: human-genome-project
description: Scientists began the massive effort to map all human genes.

name: nelson-mandela-freed
description: The anti-apartheid leader was freed after 27 years in prison.

name: dolly-sheep-cloned
description: Scientists created the first mammal cloned from an adult cell.

name: harry-potter-published
description: J.K. Rowling published the first Harry Potter book, launching a global phenomenon.

name: google-founded
description: Larry Page and Sergey Brin founded the search engine company.

name: y2k
description: The world braced for computer failures as the calendar rolled to 2000.

name: ipod-released
description: Apple launched the portable music player that transformed the music industry.

name: human-genome-completed
description: Scientists completed mapping the entire human genetic code.

name: facebook-launched
description: Mark Zuckerberg launched the social network from his Harvard dorm room.

name: youtube-founded
description: The video-sharing platform that changed online media was created.

name: twitter-launched
description: The microblogging platform began with its 140-character posts.

name: iphone-released
description: Apple's smartphone revolutionized mobile technology and communication.

name: obama-elected
description: The United States elected its first African American president.

name: bitcoin-created
description: The mysterious Satoshi Nakamoto launched the first cryptocurrency.

name: instagram-launched
description: The photo-sharing app that transformed social media was released.

name: higgs-boson
description: Scientists at CERN confirmed the existence of the God particle.

name: marriage-equality-us
description: The Supreme Court ruled same-sex marriage legal nationwide.

name: metoo-movement
description: A social movement against sexual harassment spread globally on social media.

name: covid-pandemic
description: The World Health Organization declared a global pandemic.

name: chatgpt-released
description: OpenAI launched the AI chatbot that sparked a technological revolution.
